intro: [WRONG START] Boronia tecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boronias, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is adapted to sandy soils. Boronia tecta is often found in open habitats and is known for its fragrant blooms that attract pollinators.
